ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and let him share in my task,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and let him share my task
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Let him be my partner in this task
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “And make him a partner in my task.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And let him share my task,"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And associate him (with me) in my affair,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and associate him with me in my task.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And let him share my task,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and let him share my task,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And associate him in my affair.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and make him my associate in my task,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And make him share my task:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And let him share my task (of conveying Allah's Message and Prophethood),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and let him share my task,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And have him share in my mission.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And let him share my task
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:32] and let him share in my affair, namely, in [the delivery of] the Message (both verbs [ushdud, ‘confirm’, and ashrikhu, ‘let him share’] are in the imperative and in the apocopated imperfect tense, constituting the response to the request [of Moses]).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And let him) Lord (share my task) of conveying the message to Pharaoh,
